intro: Sida pringlei, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, heart-shaped leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sida pringlei is also known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
